subject: Sales
title: The Columbo Close
description: A 60-second lesson on The Columbo Close.

hook.text: Columbo always said 'Just one more thing...' as he left. Sellers borrowed that trick brilliantly.

buildup.text: The Columbo close saves the strongest benefit for after the main conversation appears to end.

discovery.text: Defenses drop when a meeting seems over. The guard comes down and the last point hits hardest.

twist.text: Done poorly, it's sneaky. Done gracefully, it feels like a genuine afterthought â€” and that's the magic.

climax.text: Save one powerful benefit for your exit line. The last thing said is the first thing remembered.

punchline.text: The most powerful point lands after goodbye.

quiz.question: Why does the Columbo close work?
options: Defenses drop when the conversation seems over
